Description: Six joining sherds of an Egyptian red siltware pottery plate. All the surfaces are coated with a red slip, which has been pebble-burnished to produce a striped effect. This technique is attested in the Twenty-sixth dynasty.
Curator's comments: Cf. Leclère & Spencer 2014, Tell Dafana Reconsidered, 100, no. 23664, pls 32, 58; 101, no 23663, pl. 32.
Part of the same vessel as 1965,0930.503.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.013)
